Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பொதுநோக்கான் வேந்தன் வரிசையா நோக்கின் அதுநோக்கி வாழ்வார் பலர்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: If the king does not look on all alike, but looks on each man according to his merit, many relatives will live near him.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A wise king is on his throne, distributing rewards and attention. He is not looking at everyone with the same general gaze ('பொதுநோக்கான்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: Instead, he is shown carefully assessing each of his relatives and subjects individually, using a magical monocle that reveals their true merit. He is giving greater honor to those with greater merit ('வரிசையா நோக்கின்').
Layered_Composition.Background: Because of this fair and merit-based system of recognition, a large and diverse group of talented and loyal relatives and supporters ('பலர்') are drawn to his court, eager to live and serve under him ('அதுநோக்கி வாழ்வார்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A king who does not treat everyone the same, but instead recognizes and rewards each person according to their individual merit, will attract many to live and thrive under his rule.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The magical monocle of merit is a symbol for his discerning gaze. The varying levels of rewards he gives out show his non-uniform but fair judgment.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A clear, just light fills the throne room. The people of higher merit have a brighter aura, which the king is recognizing. The atmosphere is one of hopeful ambition and fair play.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A wide shot of the court scene, focusing on the king's act of discerning judgment.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with rich detail in the court and the diverse crowd.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Bright, clear lighting befitting a just court.
